trustfund:
TF039354-ZAMBIA - PUBLIC SECTOR REFORM
            & EXPORT PROMO CREDIT,TF035561-ZAMBIA - PUBLIC SECTOR REFORM,
            EXPORT PROMOTION,TF035494-ZAMBIA - PUBLIC SECTOR REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Sector Reform and Export
            Promotion Credit Project will support measures that will: a)
            facilitate completion of the privatization of the copper
            parastatal by assisting in its labor reduction program; b)
            improve the performance of the public service by reforming
            pay and employment practices and improving management
            controls; c) promote private investment by improving access
            to imported inputs and streamlining investment approvals;
            and d) strengthen the delivery of social services by
            monitoring budget allocations to key social expenditure
            categories and supporting key policy reforms. The credit
            will bring about faster economic growth, employment
            creation, and poverty reduction. There are two possible
            risks: 1) It is possible that the Government's reform
            could falter due to policy reversal, the impact of major
            external shocks, or a continuing shortfall in external donor
            support. The Government's steadfast commitment,
            privatization of Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines, and
            efforts to expand non-mining exports will help withstand the
            risk. 2) The second risk, related to the reforms supported
            by the credit, is mitigated Government's continuing
            consultation with all major stakeholders.
